intro: Conyza messerii, commonly known as Messer's ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small clusters of tiny flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, and it produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Conyza messerii plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a food source for certain insects and animals.
